page.title: 02Llanilid Church
page.content: {Llanilid Church}is said to be the oldest church in Britain. When in Llanilid we noticed a large stone block in the churchyard. Behind it were fields. We found out that coffins were carried through the fields and were placed on the stone block so that the bearers could have a rest. A tradition talks of a great visit to{Caractacus}at Llanilid by none other than{St.Paul.}They had earlier met in Rome, about AD 58-59 when they were prisoners. Llanilid Church is very ancient but still looks and is a very nice church. When I visited the church we could see what was left of the motte. It had a circumference of about 140 paces. We thought that the stone from the motte might have been used for the church. A tree in the churchyard is said to have sprouted seven other trees of different kinds.
